channel.title: Portfolio website for Lucksika Chaikul
channel.description: Recent content on Portfolio website for Lucksika Chaikul

item.title: The World Through My Lens, Koh Tao, Thailand
item.description: The best diving site so far. Definitely recommend to everyone. You will be able to see wrecks, fish and all sorts of unimaginable things. Exclusive marine life and crystal clear fish. This will make you want for more. -Summer 2019-

item.title: Mask Acceptance in the United States
item.description: Using a choropleth plot to show the degree of mask acceptance in the US Github source for data https://github.com/nytimes/covid-19-data/tree/master/mask-use Getting the data #Source for data url <- "https://github.com/nytimes/covid-19-data/raw/master/mask-use/mask-use-by-county.csv" #naming the data nyt_mask_survey <- read_csv(url) #cleaning the data and setting up new variables to make the data more understandable nyt_mask_survey <- nyt_mask_survey %>% clean_names() %>% mutate( mostly_yes= frequently+always, mostly_no = never+rarely, delta = mostly_yes-mostly_no ) glimpse(nyt_mask_survey) ## Rows: 3,142 ## Columns: 9 ## $ countyfp <chr> "01001", "01003", "01005", "01007", "01009", "01011", "010… ## $ never <dbl> 0.

item.title: SAT scores vs. First Year College scores
item.description: Are SAT scores a good indication of success in college library(tidyverse) library(moderndive) library(here) library(GGally) library(broom) # I pre-wrangled and pre-manipulated this data for you # so you only have to load it here sat_gpa <- read_csv(here::here("data", "sat_gpa.csv")) How well do SAT scores correlate with freshman GPA and also when considering sex? #Using the GGally package to build a mix of interesting and useful plots and correlations sat_gpa %>% #choosing the data of interest; highschool sat and gpa score and gpa of \nfirst year in college.

item.title: The World Through My Lens, Greece Diving Site
item.description: An underwater archway diving trip at Paleokastritsa, Corfu, Greece. It hosts numerous rock alleyways and caves for diving enthusiasts to explore the natural scenery created by volcanic eruptions in the past. I would definitely recommend this diving site for those who seek for challenging divings as you would have to balance yourself very carefully to go through each cave and alleyway. -Summer 2018-

item.title: The World Through My Lens, Koh Tao, Thailand
item.description: The best diving site so far. Definitely recommend to everyone. You will be able to see wrecks, fish and all sorts of unimaginable things. Exclusive marine life and crystal clear fish. This will make you want for more. -Summer 2019-

item.title: Uncovering the effects of climate change on world temperature
item.description: Climate change and temperature anomalies Data obtained: - Combined Land-Surface Air and Sea-Surface Water Temperature Anomalies in the Northern Hemisphere at NASA’s Goddard Institute for Space Studies (https://data.giss.nasa.gov/gistemp). - Tabular data of temperature anomalies (https://data.giss.nasa.gov/gistemp/tabledata_v3/NH.Ts+dSST.txt) Temperature anomalies reference, or base, period is the period between 1951-1980. #selecting the months only dates <- weather %>% select(Year:Dec) #converting dataframe to 'variables'long' format tidyweather <- dates %>% pivot_longer(col = Jan:Dec, names_to= "Month", values_to = "delta") glimpse(tidyweather) ## Rows: 1,680 ## Columns: 3 ## $ Year <dbl> 1880, 1880, 1880, 1880, 1880, 1880, 1880, 1880, 1880, 1880, 188… ## $ Month <chr> "Jan", "Feb", "Mar", "Apr", "May", "Jun", "Jul", "Aug", "Sep", … ## $ delta <dbl> -0.
